summary: Lalalune is actively merging pull requests into various branches, focusing on improving the build process, fixing memory save issues, and updating configurations like npmrc and lock files. They are also working on generating changelogs, enhancing tests, and adjusting server ports in environments to streamline development workflows.

summary: Ponderingdemocritus is actively working on the Eliza project, focusing primarily on code refactoring and improving logging mechanisms. Recent commits include merging branches from elizaos/eliza into their main branch, setting up prettier for log formatting, and making various cleanups to enhance readability and maintainability of the core areas of the codebase.

commits.message: add type script ref path for cleaner imports

pull_requests.title: prettier log setup, minor cleanups
pull_requests.body: - haven't changed all the logs, but it's a start and new logging could follow this structure. It's makes the printout easier to follow.

summary: Sirkitree is currently enhancing the project's automation and testing capabilities by creating a new `generate-changelog.yml` file for changelog generation, adding utility files to streamline processes, updating continuous integration (CI) configurations to include basic tests, and implementing stricter checks in various code areas. Additionally, sirkitree is actively working on multiple evaluation, message, action, runtime, goal, browser service, memory, and token provider tests, as evidenced by the nine issues opened for these tasks.

commits.message:
Update generate-changelog.yml

change name of secret

Create generate-changelog.yml

Adding a github action for generating a CHANGELOG.md file automatically when a new tag is created.
update ci to run the basic test
correct places were stricter checking is now in place

pull_requests.title: 181  generate changelog
pull_requests.body:
Adding a github action for generating a CHANGELOG.md file automatically when a new tag is created.

# Relates to:

Closes #181

# Risks

low

# Background

## What does this PR do?
Add a github action that create a CHANGELOG.md file

## What kind of change is this?
Features (non-breaking change which adds functionality)

# Testing
1. create a new tag
2. verify that a changelog was added to the repo

opened.title: Evaluation Tests
opened.body:
Task is to look at the following test and verify that they are necessary and working:

- Located in `core/tests/evaluation.test.ts`
- Tests evaluation system:
    - Evaluator format validation
    - Context loading
    - Example validation
    - Evaluation process execution

opened.title: Messages Tests
opened.body:
Task is to look at the following test and verify that they are necessary and working:

- Located in `core/tests/messages.test.ts`
- Tests message formatting and handling:
    - Actor formatting
    - Message formatting
    - Facts formatting
    - Message content validation

opened.title: Continue Action Tests
opened.body:
Task is to look at the following test and verify that they are necessary and working:

- Located in `core/tests/continue.test.ts`
- Tests the continue action:
    - Validation function responses
    - Message handling
    - Database interactions
    - Action state management

opened.title: Actions Tests
opened.body:
Task is to look at the following test and verify that they are necessary and working:

- Located in `core/tests/actions.test.ts`
- Tests action system:
    - Action loading
    - Action validation
    - Action handler execution
    - Test actions (TEST\_ACTION and TEST\_ACTION\_FAIL)

opened.title: Runtime Tests
opened.body:
Task is to look at the following test and verify that they are necessary and working:

- Located in `core/tests/runtime.test.ts`
- Tests core runtime functionality:
    - Runtime instance creation
    - Memory lifecycle within runtime
    - State management
    - Basic runtime operations

opened.title: Goals Tests
opened.body:
Task is to look at the following test and verify that they are necessary and working:

- Located in `core/tests/goals.test.ts` and `core/tests/goal.test.ts`
- Tests goal management functionality:
    - Goal creation
    - Goal updates
    - Status management
    - Objective tracking

opened.title: Token Provider Tests
opened.body:
Task is to look at the following test and verify that they are necessary and working:
 
- Located in `core/tests/token.test.ts`
- Tests token-related functionality:
    - Fetching token security data
    - Token holder information
    - Trade data retrieval
    - Formatted token reports

comments.author: normand1
comments.body: I'm taking a look at getting these to run

comments.author: odilitime
comments.body: In jest or vitest? Because it sounds like we’re switching to vitest now

comments.author: normand1
comments.body:
@odilitime I was going to fix the existing tests that aren't running first, but can look at rewriting in Vitest too if that's the plan. ~~I'm hoping that was a mistake in the other issue because it doesn't actually make sense to me to switch if there's a bunch of tests already written in jest (which is also much more standard for nodejs projects like this)~~ 

Edit: Vitest is actually backwards compatible with jest and handles ts and modules much better. I'm sold on vitest.

opened.title: Browser Service Tests
opened.body:
Task is to look at the following test and verify that they are necessary and working:

- Located in `core/src/test_resources/basic.test.ts`
- Simple test suite that verifies:
    - Basic test functionality works
    - Environment variables are accessible
    - Confirms NODE\_ENV is 'test' and TEST\_DATABASE\_CLIENT is 'sqlite'

opened.title: Memory Tests
opened.body:
Task is to look at the following test and verify that they are necessary and working:

- Located in `core/tests/memory.test.ts`
- Tests memory-related functionality:
    - Search memories by embedding similarity
    - Validates memory ranking based on similarity scores
    - Tests memory lifecycle (creation, search, and removal)
    - Verifies embedding caching functionality

summary: Madjin is actively updating documentation pages for the project, including adding mermaid support and placeholder pages. They have also merged branches from 'main' and 'elizaos:main', removed broken links, added new dog-related content, and worked on a changelog generator issue in areas of operations, automation, and enhancement.

commits.message: update docs pages, add mermaid support

opened.title: Changelog generator
opened.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

https://keepachangelog.com/en/1.1.0/

**Describe the solution you'd like**

https://github.com/github-changelog-generator/github-changelog-generator

**Describe alternatives you've considered**

https://github.com/github-changelog-generator/github-changelog-generator/wiki/Alternatives

**Additional context**

- would need a github token to use this: https://github.com/github-changelog-generator/github-changelog-generator?tab=readme-ov-file#github-token

Attaching a sample changelog
[CHANGELOG.md](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17612217/CHANGELOG.md)

comments.author: sirkitree
comments.body: I think this would be a great addition to the the automated release notes that come with Github when creating a release from a tag.

comments.author: madjin
comments.body: Haven't tested yet but this one looks useful for that: https://github.com/mikepenz/release-changelog-builder-action

comments.author: sirkitree
comments.body: Taking a stab at making this a github action that will run when we create a new tag. I'll note that i'm unsure if I setup the token and referenced it correctly within the github action so we'll need to create a tag after merging this to test.

comments.author: sirkitree
comments.body: Still working to get this right - I have a github action setup which generates the file, now I need to get it to commit the file automatically.

comments.author: sirkitree
comments.body:
success!

sorry for the noise of the bogus tags, but it took some testing

https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md

summary: MarcoMandar is actively enhancing the platform by adding features like last active, decay score, token recommendations, validation trust, and updating order book and trust scores. He has merged two pull requests from elizaos/main and made significant code changes to core areas of the project with a focus on improving virtual confidence and multiple recommender systems.

commits.message:
Merge pull request #15 from elizaos/main

merge from main

Merge pull request #14 from elizaos/main

merge from main

add last active and decay score, update token recommendations, add validation trust to token performance and add calculateValidationTrust

Signed-off-by: MarcoMandar <malicemandar@gmail.com>

opened.title: build docs doesn't seem to be working

summary: rhlsthrm is currently addressing a bug related to a Telegram bot not returning responses, as evidenced by their recent activity on GitHub. They have engaged with the issue through one reported problem but haven't made any pull requests or commits towards resolving it yet. Their focus remains primarily on troubleshooting and identifying potential solutions for this specific functionality issue within the project.

opened.title: Telegram bot not returning responses
opened.body: **Describe the bug** Does not respond to messages, just prints forever in the console. **To Reproduce** * Load custom character file from `tweets2character`. * Set up Telegram bot token. * Try to chat with bot. **Expected behavior** Bot responds. **Screenshots** Prints these logs forever. **Additional context** Running with LlamaLocal model.
